entries.text: Frontier's official customer support page advertises support agents available 24/7 via call, chat, or text, and also routes customers to self-service and special forms for common issues.
Frontier's support page directs customers affected by significant delays or cancellations to a rebooking and refund options portal, separate from the general support page flow.
Frontier's customer support page links to the My Trip / Check-In portal for self-service trip management and check-in actions.

Frontier's support page includes baggage-related assistance routes (including delayed/damaged baggage support and a baggage service office locator / tracking path), indicating baggage support is spread across multiple specialized surfaces.

Frontier's support page and FAQ include dedicated paths for accessibility and special services requests, including a support request entry point and FAQ articles for adding or modifying special services.

Frontier's FAQ includes separate articles for cancellation refunds, delay/cancellation-related refund eligibility, and payment/refund history, which can force customers to navigate multiple pages to understand their exact path.
Frontier's FAQ includes a dedicated missed-flight article, which is a high-friction customer issue that benefits from fast triage and rebooking guidance rather than generic contact routing.

Trustpilot's Frontier review page (user-generated) shows a very low score with recurring complaints about support, cancellations, and refund handling. This is a directional signal, not an official Frontier source.

current_strengths: Official customer support hub clearly lists multiple support channels (call, chat, text)
24/7 support availability is advertised on the official support page
Strong self-service surfaces (My Trip / Check-In and special support forms)
Large official FAQ catalog for common support issues
Dedicated pages/paths for baggage and special services
current_gaps_observed_or_likely: Support and resolution steps remain fragmented across support hub, FAQ pages, travel portal, and specialized forms
No public evidence of one conversation that carries context across text, voice, and handoff
No public indication of proactive disruption concierge behavior with recovery options in one thread
No public customer-visible request tracker that follows a case through chat/voice to resolution
Customers likely need to self-select the correct support path before the system helps them
